revised_title: The Role of Lantern in Locomotion of Sea Urchins
tldr: The author investigates the role of the lantern in the locomotion of sea urchins, discovering that it plays a crucial part in their movement out of water. The lantern acts as a lever, with the muscles pushing the urchin forward and lifting it up, while the spines help in maintaining balance. This study provides a deeper understanding of the mechanics of sea urchin locomotion and their adaptation to their environment.
